required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Determining the Depth of Endotracheal Tube Insertion

brief_summary.textblock:
1. Airway length from the medial incisor to carina is divided into four segments ; the length from medial incisor to mouth angle, mouth angle to epiglottis, epiglottis to vocal cords and vocal cords to carina.
2. Determining the mean length of each segments with the direct laryngoscope, videolaryngoscope and fiberoptic bronchoscope at the time of endotracheal intubation.
3. Making a new formula to determine the proper individualized depth of intubation on the basis of the length of segments
4. Virtual experiment : comparing the new formula with conventional method of determining the depth of endotracheal intubation

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of Airway Length Between Male and Female
primary_outcome.description: Airway length is defined the distance from medial incisor to carina. It is divided into four parts. It is medial incisor to mouth angle, mouth angle to epiglottis tip, epiglottis tip to vocal cords and vocal cords to carina.

primary_outcome.measure: Airway Length vs Height in Male
Airway Length vs Height in Female

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison Between Conventional Method and Touch and Read Method for Risk Group of Male
secondary_outcome.description: Normal group is defined as the patients whose airway length from medial incisor to carina is below 25cm. Conventional method : depth of intubation is 23cm at the medial incisor for male. Touch and read method : depth of intubation is calculated as follow : length from mouth angle to epiglottis tip plus 12.5cm for male.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison Between Conventional Method and Touch and Read Method for Normal Group of Male
secondary_outcome.description: Normal group is defined as the patients whose airway length from medial incisor to carina is over 25cm. Conventional method : depth of intubation is 23cm at the medial incisor for male. Touch and read method : depth of intubation is calculated as follow : length from mouth angle to epiglottis tip plus 12.5cm for male.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison Between Conventional Method and Touch and Read Method for Risk Group of Female
secondary_outcome.description: Risk group is defined as the patients whose airway length from medial incisor to carina is below 23cm. Conventional method : depth of intubation is 21cm at the medial incisor for female. Touch and read method : depth of intubation is calculated as follow : length from mouth angle to epiglottis tip plus 11.5cm for female.

secondary_outcome.measure: Comparison Between Conventional Method and Touch and Read Method for Normal Group of Female
secondary_outcome.description: Normal group is defined as the patients whose airway length from medial incisor to carina is over 23cm. Conventional method : depth of intubation is 21cm at the medial incisor for female. Touch and read method : depth of intubation is calculated as follow : length from mouth angle to epiglottis tip plus 11.5cm for female.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Conventional group, Touch and Read group

study_pop.textblock: Patients who are taking operation in the university hospital

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who are scheduled to take general anesthesia with endotracheal intubation
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing general anesthesia with face mask ventilation or laryngeal mask airway

facility.name: Department of Anesthesia and Pain Medicine, Daejeon St Mary's hospital

group.title: Tough and Read Group
group.description: This is a virtual experiment based on the anthropometry of the airway length. Conventional group : We defined the conventional group as patients who are intubated on the depth of 25cm for male and 23 cm fo female from the medial incisor virtually. Touch and read group : Depth of intubation was determined on the measurement of the airway length of each patient. In touch and read group, the depth of intubation was determined by the sum of the length from the mouth angle to epiglottis tip, the length from the epiglottis tip to vocal cords and 8cm for the endotracheal tube #7.0. Length from the mouth angle to epiglottis tip is determined at the time of intubation with specially scaled endotracheal tube.

group.title: Touch and Read Group(Male)
group.description: This is a virtual experiment based on the anthropometry of the airway length. We defined the conventional group as patients who are intubated on the depth of 25cm for male and 23 cm fo female from the medial incisor virtually. Touch and read group : Depth of intubation was determined on the measurement of the airway length of each patient. In touch and read group, the depth of intubation was determined by the sum of the length from the mouth angle to epiglottis tip, the length from the epiglottis tip to vocal cords and 8cm for the endotracheal tube #7.0. Length from the mouth angle to epiglottis tip is determined at the time of intubation with specially scaled endotracheal tube.

outcome.title: Airway Length vs Height in Male

group.title: Airway Length vs Height in Male
group.description: Relationship between airway length and their height are analyzed with linear regression. Airway length is defined the distance from mouth angle to carina. Additionally it is divided into three parts, from mouth angle to epiglottis tip, epiglottis tip to vocal cords and vocal cords to carina.

measure.title: Airway Length vs Height in Male

outcome.title: Airway Length vs Height in Female

group.title: Female Airway Length vs Height

Additionally it is divided into three parts, from mouth angle to epiglottis tip, epiglottis tip to vocal cords and vocal cords to carina.

event.description: Adverse events were not collected for this study.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
